sentences: Silmad on inimese ja enamiku loomade nägemiselundid.
Kassi hiilgavad silmad muutuvad öösel valgeks.
context: The word 'silmad' is the nominative plural form of the Estonian noun 'silm', which means eye or eyes. It refers to the paired visual organs in humans and most animals that enable sight. The singular form would be 'silm'. In Estonian grammar, this follows typical declension patterns for nouns ending in -d in their plural forms.
